question: Which of the following is the language from which "Guinea-Bissau Creole" is derived?
explanation: Guinea-Bissau Creole is a creole language whose lexicon derives mostly from Portuguese. It is spoken in Guinea Bissau, Senegal and The Gambia. Guinea-Bissau Creole is spoken as a native tongue by approximately 15% of Bissau-Guineans and as a second language by approximately 50%.
